inn1.comm: and an appeal right away, some movement from the seam, hits Tharanga on the knee roll, umpire says not out, looked to be a bit high, might have been going down leg
comes forward and eases a fuller one towards mid off
just around a length and going across Tharanga who comes out and blocks it towards covers
and he is away now, gets one pitched up and slightly wide outside off, Tharanga's zone all the way, gets the foot out and sends it between the gap between cover and point
goes straighter now, on the stumps, Tharanga shuffles and works it wide of midwicket
Dilshan looks for the flailing drive through covers, it is too close to off stump, and he closes the face of the bat to hit it away to mid on
skiddy length delivery that angles in to the pads, Dilshan goes through the straight drive with a flick of the wrists, and mid on dives over the ball to let it through
hammered, this could be painful for Zimbabwe if they don't sort out Dilshan, who gets one marginally short and latches on to it hungrily, pulling it over deep midwicket into the grass banks

this time he goes full, but provides Dilshan just a hint of width outside off stump, mistake, he latches on to it with that whiplash drive that goes in the huge gap between extra cover and mid off, horror start for Panyangara

more trouble for Zimbabwe, this time Dilshan gets on top of one that bounces outside off stump, cuts hard, and the ball races past point and beats squarish third man who was hardly a few paces from it
finally some respite for the bowler, Dilshan defends an angled delivery with the straightest of bats in to the off side
another one blocked in to the off side, still 18 runs off this over
too close to off stump for Tharanga to go for the drive, eases it away to short extra cover
this will help, poor bowling, gentle full delivery way outside off stump, Tharanga loves it there, and reaches out to smash it over covers
goes leg stump now, and Tharanga flicks it away wide of midwicket

whoops, Dilshan is in some mood today, not much wrong with this one, slowish length ball around middle, but Dilshan shuffles a bit and heaves it away with those wrists backward of  square leg, and fine leg had no chance
looks to pull this one away through midwicket, but gets an inside edge on to body pad and close to off stump
slower one this time, well bowled, he picks it late and defends it down the track
bounces outside off stump from short of a good length, left alone quietly
better start from Panyangara to the over, fuller now around off and Tharanga drives it without power to mid off
again Dilshan latches on to one that is marginally short, doesn't bounce as much as Dilshan expected but he still pulls it away, there is man at deep midwicket now
bit of width outside off stump, he opens the face to guide it to backward point
good over so far, cramps him for room with one on the stumps, pushed away in to the leg side
and almost gets Tharanga this time, had him feeling for one that was angled across on off stump, Tharanga brought down an angled bat, and the inside edge rolled away perilously close to the stumps
pushed through flat on middle stump, some turn, he plays it out towards covers
coming slowly on middle stump from a length, he goes back and works it away in front of square leg
bowled quicker and very flat, he pushes hard at it
Dilshan takes Price on, lovely use of the feet, gets to the pitch and opens up to drive it past short extra cover
nudged backward of square off the back foot
thinks about the charge again, but stays in the crease to block this ball coming in with the angle on the leg side
111.6 slower one, he adjusts the front foot movement to push it away in to covers
short and wide, but he cannot capitalise as he reaches out to play the cut, the ball kept low, that's why
steers this one that is not that wide outside off stump, and it goes through gully's hands wide of third man
Tharanga lofts wide of mid on, and Tharanga gets four, friendly length delivery around middle and leg stump, and he goes through with the swing, and mid on's desperate dive was in vain
makes some room outside leg stump now to one that is short of a length, and steers it to third man

he had set himself up for the slap-drive through extra cover, but it came in off the seam, and he under-edged it close to the stumps, he thought he could at least get a single, but point was quick to get to the ball
goes a long way outside leg stump, and looks to cut this one away, but hits it to extra cover in the end
gets a thick inside edge that goes towards square leg as he looks to drive through midwicket
has Dilshan charging out again, with one that dipped on the batsman, and he lofts it on the bounce to mid off
goes down on a knee for the sweep, but the ball is fired wide down the leg side
and again he skips down the track, this time gets nicely to the pitch of the ball, and lifts it over mid off for a boundary
almost got him this time, Dilshan is in a big hurry, rushes down the track again, but is beaten in flight this time, and squeezes the ball on the off side close to the keeper
angled down the pads, he looks to pull it away behind square leg, cannot get the timing on the shot
stays in the crease and pushes a length ball to mid on and brings Dilshan on strike

Dilshan is living dangerously, gets away again, surprised him with the bouncer, he looked to belatedly hook, but the top edge fell just short of short fine leg, maybe he could have come in a bit faster
driven confidently off the front foot to mid off
closer to off stump now, blocked away tho short extra cover
no room for Tharanga to work this one away, he plays it out on the leg side
goes for the yorker, gets it very full too, but marginally down the pads, they call them wides in limited-overs cricket
slower one now, but it has some width, he steers it down to third man
this time it's Tharanga's chance to get away, Price is getting them in all sorts of trouble, tharanga got too close to a flighted one, but his lofted shot fell way short of long on
this is what Dilshan was looking to do earlier, Price fires one in just a bit short and on the pads, he swivels and pulls it over square leg
Dilshan is in a tearing hurry, comes down the track for that inside out drive through covers, but it goes on the bounce to extra cover
played away towards midwicket
goes for the sweep now, but short fine leg is placed very fine indeed
nudged away towards square leg from the crease

there is a man at deep midwicket, he will need him often if he bowls long hops like this one, short and sitting up for Dilshan to have a go, he went at it so fast that he got only a single as it flew to deep midwicket
this time there is no protection for the poor short delivery down the leg side, fine leg is in the circle, and Tharanga flays it high over that man
better delivery, getting him to defend from the back foot as this one moves away off the seam from around leg stump
115.5 kph slower one, and cutting across Tharanga again, who has neither pace nor room to do anything with it, and plonks it down
tharanga likes this angle, he shows that by getting the front foot out and swinging through the line, lovely timing as it flies over mid off
he really loves this angle, even more so if it is ending up down the pads, and pulls it away backward of square leg, Zimbabwe have nowhere to hide at the moment
starts with a length ball down the pads, and he shuffles to flick it to fine leg
short and coming slowly off the track, he gets away as Tharanga cannot get it wide enough of fine leg with the pull
goes a bit fuller and angles it into dilshan's pads, he misses out with the flick and is hit on the pads, comfortably sliding down leg
played away in to the leg side close to the wicket
Zimbabwe are just feeding Sri Lanka with dollies, short and wide, even if Dilshan mistimes the cut, there is no slip, and the outside edge flies fine to the boundary, third man is nowhere close to it
cracked off the front foot, the man is looking in ominous touch, just a single this time wide of mid off
goes for the sweep, hits it straight to short fine leg
high full toss, he is surprised and pushes it away to mid off
bowled slowly through the air, he works it away off the pads to short fine leg
much fuller from round the wicket, eased down to long on
another high full toss, he comes down the track and pushes it away to long on
sees him skip down the pitch, and fires it in to the pads, Tharanga still gets it down to long on with the momentum
pushed across the batsman, who cuts it to extra cover
78.7 kph flighted slowly through the air, he waited for it to come on and was beaten outside off as he pushed out
pushed off the back foot to the bowler
takes a step to the pitch of this one on middle and eases it away to Price
nice tight stuff from Price, he blocks it away towards midwicket
cannot get this one on the pads wide of square leg, maiden in the Powerplay, Pricey stuff
flicked away to deep midwicket
worked away off the hip to midwicket who dives to save a run
fired in and goes on with the angle, flicked backward of square leg
goes for the sweep, cannot beat short fine leg
gets the run finally, pushes a fuller one to long on
Utseya fires in a full toss as he sees Dilshan in the mood to leave the crease, he drives it down to long off
goes on straight with the arm, cramps him for room even as he backs away outside leg, hit back to the bowler
tossed up slowly, played back to the bowler
defended back to the bowler off the front foot
goes on the back foot, Price is doing a super job here, he still cannot get it past the bowler
and again, he is backing away outside leg, and Price fires them in, another one pushed away down the track
bowls it a bit fuller, and Dilshan makes room to drive it to long off, and that will be his half-century, raises his bat to loud cheers
goes slashing at one that was pushed through very quickly and full, it was turning in on off stump, but Dilshan went flaying at it, and the outside edge was too fast for short third man
blocked with a straight bat down the track
worked away behind square on the leg side
drives inside out wide of long off, and a comfortable couple is taken
steered away to short third man from the crease
goes very full, he is ready and hits it down to long on
wants to turn this away from the batsman, but he flights it way down the leg side, Dilshan happily sweeps it wide of short fine leg, brings the 100 up
goes back to one that turns slightly away, and bashes it down to long off
better line to the left hander, tossed up and turning in around middle, pushed back to the bowler
slightly short, and he goes back to work it away on the leg side, cannot get it past square leg
gets the outside edge now, which one that goes straight on after pitching on leg, he wanted to play it with the turn in front of square leg, it goes away to short third man

another one goers straight on, this time outside off stump, Dilshan goes flailing at it from the crease, but the inside edge goes past the stumps to short fine leg, no justice in the world, if you are Cremer
angled in and turning further from wide of the crease, Dilshan misses the sweep
short of a length outside off, Dilshan hangs back and cracks it square for a single
back of a length from round the stumps, Tharanga leans out to defend
some daring flight on leg stump, Tharanga presses forward and guides to midwicket
again tossed up slowly on leg stump and straightening, Tharanga works it against the spin through midwicket for one
shortish ball on the off stump line to end the over, Dilshan stays back and steers through point for one more
tossed up generously on off and breaking away, driven with the spin into the covers
holds the length back but again gets big away spin, Dilshan waits and pokes it into the covers
good stuff from Cremer, tighter line and lesser turn this time, cramping Dilshan into easing into the covers again
flight this time on leg stump, Dilshan chips through midwicket and turns the strike at long last
Tharanga leans across and nudges off the pads with the spin. Backward square leg stops it
flighted on leg stump to end the over, clipped with the turn through midwicket for one more. From mayhem mode to milking mode, Sri Lanka's openers are setting their sights high today.
ample flight on middle stump, Tharanga reaches to the flight and forces it down the ground for one more single
Dilshan leans out to the spin and defends into the off side
looped and turning into the pads, Dilshan calmly flicks past midwicket for a single
back of a length on the stumps, Tharanga defends down the track
flighted on the pads this time, Tharanga again reaches out to defend down the track
width to end the over, Tharanga steers through point for a single
loopy delivery on middle, Tharanga taps it to midwicket
tospinner, landed back of a length, Tharanga hangs back and clips square for a single
Dilshan jumps out, gets close to the flight and drives through midwicket for one
hmm, Cremer continues to turn the ball prodigiously, Tharanga reaches out to the pitch and drives through mid off for a single
short of a length, breaking away and it gets cut through point for one
and a wide down the leg side.
googly, but dropped too short to trouble anyone. Tharanga cuts with the spin and gets a single to deep point
turns in from outside off, Dilshan forces against the spin into the covers
back of a length from round the wicket, Tharanga works it off the back foot to backward square leg
short of a length again, Tharanga works it to the leg side for one more
more turn this time, comes in sharply as Dilshan prepares to cut, and he gets it away for another single
drifts onto the pads, Tharanga flicks but can't get to his 50 yet.
now he does. Full delivery on leg stump, punched off the front foot down the ground for one.
looped up on off stump, forced off the back foot for a single
Dilshan reaches out to the spin and carves him into the covers for a couple
back of a length this time, Dilshan stays back and defends down the track
easy runs, easy as they come. Full delivery outside off, Tharanga opens the face as he shapes to cut and picks up a couple more towards deep backward point.
short this time, Tharanga happily hangs back and cuts for a single
Dilshan leans out to the pitch and drives down the ground for yet another single
flighted on the stumps, driven back to the bowler
flatter and on the pads, Dilshan turns it with the angle to midwicket
back of a length outside off, Dilshan opens the face and guides backward of point for a single
on the pads, Tharanga dinks it backward of square leg but can't find the single
tossed up on off stump, Tharanga drives with the spin through mid off
short of a length on the pads, worked with the angle for a single through backward square leg
Tharanga closes the face a little too early as he looks to flick and the leading edge goes to cover.
tossed up outside off, Tharanga skips out and drives through mid off for a single
turn from leg stump, plays into Dilshan's hands as he drives through mid off for a single
flatter on the pads, Tharanga nudges square and they steal another singles. They are stealing more singles here than a cheap Indipop band does from Western composers.
short ad turning away sharply, Dilshan hacks through point for one more
another short shocker, Tharanga gladly cashes in, rocking back and thumping it emphatically in front of square.
and now a short ball for Dilshan, who leans back and cuts delicately backward od point. The fielder sweeping on the backward point boundary does really well to prevent four
this time, even that fielder can't do much. Dilshan adjusts superbly, waiting that extra instant before playing the cut, to get it fine of that fielder, while also eluding third man.
tossed up this time, Dilshan jumps out to the pitch and drives. He finds covers though.
another single, the 150 is up as Dilshan pokes into the covers. The bowling is not posing any challenge at the moment.
tossed up on the pads, Tharanga works it to long on and ambles along somnolently for an easy single
Dilshan opens the face and dabs another easy single into the cover point area.
Dilshan skips out and drives with a flick of the wrists through long on for a single
slow loopy delivery outside off, Tharanga leans out and defends to the off side
tossed up this time, Tharanga covers the line with his stride across and sweeps to backward square leg for one
drift onto the pads, Dilshan works it to the leg side for a single
flighted on the pads, driven down the ground for one more single
leggie breaking away from Dilshan, guided for another single to third man
slides down the leg side, Tharanga misses the sweep but probably got some pad on it, en route Taibu's gloves.
tossed up on off, Tharanga reaches forward and defends
over-pitched on leg stump, Tharanga drives down the ground for a single
short of a length and turning in, Dilshan slaps it into the covers for one more
loopy non-descript ball on the toes, Tharanga drives for another single to long on
flighted on middle and breaking in, Dilshan drives inside out for another single through extra cover.
length ball angles into the pads innocuously, and is worked through midwicket for a couple
back of a length on off stump, defended from the crease down the pitch
similar ball, Dilshan holds his guns and defends again
width on offer, Dilshan stays rooted and flails outside the off stump. Can't connect this time.
just enough width outside off for Dilshan to open the face and steers through cover point for a single
Tharanga fishes outside off for a dlivery angled across him and misses the steer to third man
Lamb turns this one into the pads and is lucky to escape as Dilshan's sweep finds short fine leg
turning in from back of a length, Dilshan hangs back and defends to the off side
full toss on the leg stumop, but too low for the agrucultural swipe. Dilshan bunts to long on for one more
on Tharanga's pads, very full and he can't flick through midwicket for a single
eases into the covers with the spin for a single.
short of a length outside off, Dilshan hangs on the crease and dabs towards point for one more single
short and wide at 128 kph, again lucky that Dilshan can't beat point with his fierce cut shot

spanked with cruelty. Savage and without any pretence of finesse. That's Dilshan at his visceral best. Over-pitched a foot outside off. The man doesn't get across to the pitch, he just stays put and flays through the line into the covers. 99 now.

9th ODI ton for Dilshan and the first in the World Cup. He's pleased as punch, this means a lot to him. Gets a back of length ball, he skips into line and dabs into the covers. Even as he runs, the dressing room stands up as one, while a buzz emanates from the appreciative crowd. He shouts in happiness and throws his arms up. Well played, Dilshan!
short of a length on off stump, Tharanga stays on the crease and defends to the off side. He's slowed down, but there's enough time for a 100 for him as well.
aha, Elton nearly gets one through him. Tharanga looks to steer from very close to the stumps and gets an inside edge past the stumps.
Elton appreciates Dilshan's ton and marks the occasion with a gift - a nothing delivery heading down the leg side. Dilshan swipes it along the way for four more to fine leg
back of a length, Tharanga stays on the crease and defends
tossed up on off, Tharanga leans out to the pitch and lofts past wide mid off for a single
turning in from outside off, Dilshan drives through mid off for a single
Tharanga backs away to the leg side, looking for the off side loft, and plays softly for a single to the deep
hideous bowling. Full toss on off stump, Dilshan cracks it with that heaved drive of his into the deep. Panyangara runs a mile from deep backward point and uses the boot to save a four
quicker ball, looks to cramp Tharanga as he backs away, but it slips too wide down the leg side
on the leg stump to end the over, driven down to long on for a single

Panyangara - keeps getting atacked everytime he bowls. If I remember right, this happened when he played New Zealand too. First ball of a new spell, over-pitched at a friendly length on leg stump, and Tharanga lofts cleanly over mid-on for four
fullish again, Tharanga opens the off side and drives fluently to deep extra cover for a single
back of a length outside off, Dilshan cuts but finds the man in the deep
back of a length outside off, Tharanga stays back on the crease and guides backward of point.
this time he gets it away, waiting for the ball to get beside him before playing the cut, getting it backward of point. A big effort at the deep keeps him down to two

that's Tharanga's shot of the day. Short ball coming in and cramping him for room, Tharanga was not taken by surprise, even as he arrested his forward motion and slapped with a lovely sleight of the wrists. In the air, safely into the gap and nearly six through square leg
tossed up outside off and coming in, Dilshan drives against the spin to mid off
short ball, turning into the leg side and pulled with ominous timing. Misfield in the deep from Price, doesn't quite help Zimbabwe's cause.
another one speared into the pads, Dilshan heaves to Price who fields this time. Dilshan does seem a little knackered, it is hot and humid out there.
Tharanga opens the face and dabs with the spin towards point
200 for SL, comes with a wide as Utseya pushes one down the leg side.

while Dilshan is savaging them, Tharanga is doing it with a little more dignity. Fired on a length around off stump, Tharanga just stands back, uses the pace of the ball and steers it through backward point. Third man is inside the circle, and had no hopes of stopping it.
short ball again, Tharanga pulls hard to the deep for a single. Many red shirts patrolling the leg-side boundary, and just as well.
turning from middle and leg down the leg side, Tharanga dabs with the spin but finds short fine leg

oho boy. Tharanga is playing some idyllic late-afternoon glides that almost seem a throwback to an era of more non-violent batting. Short ball from Cremer, he doesn't go back and thwack it, he just eases it along with the pace of the ball, backward of point.
too much turn, Tharanga misses the heaved drive, Taibu can't collect and it is away for two byes
now he gets the single, driving solidly down the ground for one
short ball to Dilshan, he cuts expansively but finds cover point.
stays back and drives through midwicket for a single to end the over
sharp offie, lands on middle and turns in a mile. No problemo for Dilshan, who moves well to the leg side and carves through the covers for a couple

tossed up this time and turning into Dilshan, who winds up and unleashes the slog sweep. Very good work by Panyangara at deep backward square leg to stop the boundary. They only get a single, Dilshan is surely struggling
tossed up on middle and off, Tharanga drives back to the bowler
again, flighted on off stump, Tharanga plays calmly back to the bowler
huh? Forward defensive? Didn't expect to see that.
tossed up to end the over, Tharanga drives into the covers to retain strike. Before that, the players will have a glug of drinks.
looks to sweep this one from outside leg, cannot get it past short fine leg
tickled away towards square leg off the pads
flicked away down to fine leg now
fuller on the stumps, driven down to long off
tosses it up slowly, he gets an inside edge as he pushes forward, Dilshan looks sharply at Price
punched away off the back foot towards sweeper cover
goes down on a knee and tries to forcefully sweep this one, but cannot connect cleanly, he is looking tired
quicker one in the blockhole, squeezed out towards point
still no run, this time it is steered to short third man
he can't make use of the high full toss, he bashes it away right to deep midwicket
one more dot ball, it was wide outside off and turning away, but he cannot get the steer past short third man
good over from Utseya, gets him to push it back down the track
he is really struggling, wants to pull this away, but gets an inside edge close to off stump,. there have been a few of those today
goes for another forcing punch, but mistimes it down the ground to long on
pushed down the track off the front foot, where have the runs disappeared?
gives himself some room outside leg, and drives along the ground to sweeper cover
goes on the back foot, and works it away in the air towards deep square leg
fuller one, driven down to long off, somehow the scarcity of singles never affects that area
fuller one played with the turn to, long off, again
goes outside leg to make room for the turn and squeezes it away towards covers
comes forward and pushes in the air towards midwicket, they run a few steps for the single, but retreat sooner
worked away off the pads to square leg, moves to 99
Dilshan finally gets one away, wayward delivery down the pads, and he sweeps in the air over short fine leg
backs away to cut a quicker and flatter one turning in, but short third man pulls off a diving stop
there is the century for Tharanga, lovely drive to get to it, steps out to a tossed up ball and eases it past mid off, raises his bat in celebration
carved away through the covers against the spin, gave himself some room, and lofted it over the infield
drives this fuller on down the ground
Dilshan gets the single down to long off with a drive off a fuller delivery
down the track and looks to bash this full toss, but long on is in place
misses out on this one, he got down on a knee and slapped it away with good timing but extra cover is on the edge of the circle, and it goes straight to him
Tharanga backs away and throws his bat at one turning away, but the thick edge goes wide of short third man, Price dived over the ball as well
the inside out lofted shot over extra cover, connects well but cannot beat the man at sweeper cover
goes for the pull shot, he is struggling to connect them, goes on a couple of bounces to deep midwicket
tharanga is hitting some lovely lofted shots over the off-side infield, this one was a full toss on off stump, and he stepped outside leg to get the connection over a leaping extra cover
and again, this is clean efficient hitting, makes a lot of room outside leg stump, and though the bowler tried to follow him, Tharanga had enough momentum to lift the full ball over cover
this time he stays put, and goes for the sweep to this one outside leg stump, but it rolls away fine
and starts off with a no-ball, Tharanga tries to life it over midwicket, but one hand comes off the bat, it is picked up at deep square leg
Dilshan throws everything at the free hit, and gets it over midwicket, but not timed well enough to reach the ropes
goes for one more slog to a length ball, it goes on the bounce to deep midwicket
more woes for Zimbabwe, he backs away outside leg and looks to carve it through extra cover, gets an outside edge that flies past the keeper
well bowled slower delivery at 114 kph. he made room outside leg, but could no get the ball past cover
he just pushes this full delivery from outside leg stump, and it flies off the blade, too bad it went to extra cover
Zimbabwe are covering up the bowling with their fielding, Tharanga creams another full ball wide of extra cover, who dives to his left to stop a certain boundary
whoa, Tharanga hits the ball twice, once to dig out a fuller one, and then to stop it from rolling on to the stumps
driven wide of long off for a single
Dilshan comes in search of a boundary, and gets it, takes it on the half volley and carves it over extra cover
full toss on the leg stump, driven down to long on
slowly tossed up around off stump, steered to short third man
misfield at long on allows them to come back for two, it was hammered in the air by Dilshan, and the fielder failed to grab it on the bounce
looks for the carve over extra cover with a skip down the track, the bat turns in his hand and he mistimes it over midwicket
slower one leads to more mistiming, this time lofted down to long on
he stands outside off stump with feet a foot apart, and gets a fuller one that he smashes away to deep midwicket

falls just short of the world record for the highest opening partnership of 286, came down the track for another lofted one over extra cover, for once, it did not come off cleanly, went high in the air more than anything else, and was taken cleanly way inside the boundary, do Zimbabwe have some respite? Not
full delivery cracked away with a big swing to deep square leg
he is away, pushing a fuller on down the ground to long off
cut away off the back foot
tosses this outside leg stump, he hustles it down to long on
he is placing them alright even at this stage, skips down the track, takes it on the full and opens the face to place it wide of extra cover, sweeper cover, and wide long off

it's over for Dilshan now, went down the track for another big one, got too close to the ball, and lifted it miles in the air, but it came down somewhere near deep midwicket, and was taken safely, he walks back to thunderous applause, acknowledges it with a swing of his bat
makes room and looks for the slog down the ground, but gets an inside edge in front of square leg
going straight on wide outside off stump, Mahela goes back and plays the loveliest of cut shots that goes to sweeper cover
Mahela makes some room and gets enough on the cut to go past short third man and beat him to the boundary
fired in outside leg, where Mahela had set himself up, but ended up chipping it in the air towards long on
Perera goes now, he went for a wild slog to a flat delivery that goes straight on, takes the outside edge, and loops high in the air for cover to take a simple catch, Price deserved a wicket
pushed through quickly a mile down the leg side, Mahela makes no attempt to get to it
this one is much closer to leg stump, he does not connect with the sweep
good running, as if all those big shots were not enough, flicked through the vacant midwicket region, and they take two by the time deep midwicket gets to it
300 comes up for Sri Lanka with three overs to go, Mahela gets it with a sweep to fine leg off a full delivery
Mahela goes now, gets outside leg and lifts a fullish slower one right to long on who takes a fine high catch
99.3 kph slower one from round the stumps, Sanga wants to swing it over midwicket, it comes slowly off the pitch, and he hits it to deep square leg
101.6 kph, another slower one, this time he gets it wide down the leg side
the ball is following Elton all around, and he is not letting it down, Angelo skied it high looking for the slog over midwicket, and Chigumbura took a nice running catch diving forward
with one fine leg up in the circle he bowls a gentle wide ball down the leg side
yet another slower delivery, he drops it in front of covers for a single
Silva does what Mahela and Angelo could not, off his first delivery, gets a fuller delivery and lofts it wide of deep midwicket for a boundary

this was coming, one more batsman falls going for the big shot, Chamara wanted to lift this full delivery over deep midwicket again, but could not get it wide of the man this time, hit it straight to him in fact
drops it in to the off side for a single, better than giving catching practice
targets the blockhole now, worked away off the pads to deep midwicket
Thilan steps outside off stump, and plays a neat cover drive to bring Sanga on strike
more waywardness of the wide kind from Zimbabwe, down the leg side
Sanga waltzes down the track, and lofts it straight down the ground, but long off runs across to field, Thilan charges back for the second
brings Thilan on strike with a run down the ground, what can Thilan do now?
he walks outside off stump, and flicks this one away in front of square leg, a bit strange to see Thilan go about in these end overs
beats him with a slower and wide one outside off stump, he wanted to cut it away
goes walking across the stumps and down the track, and flicks through midwicket, he does this one well, actually
wow, that is some nifty work from Sanga, two steps down the track, takes it from miles outside off stump, and swings it with the wrists backward of square leg
cannot get this one away, only a single this time
Thilan gets the boundary this time, goes outside off stump, and pulls from there backward of square leg with some supple wrists

in the blockhole, they go up for an appeal as it strikes the pads, there have been precious few of those, there was one off the first ball of the innings, the umpire was not interested then, he is not interested now, Thilan missed with a swing across the line

inn2.comm: ominous start, fast and furious and swinging away from well outside off. Taylor leaves.
voila, he's already getting it to swing like crazy. 141 kph, lands just outside off and Taylor misses as he feels away from the body. So does Sanga as it snakes away.
this one slips down the leg side for a wide.
Chakabva can't see it. Full away swinger on the stumps, he looks to flick and somehow gets a leading edge into the covers. Clueless.
back of a length this time and finally a run off the bat. Regis Registers his first run, defending to the leg side
full toss on the pads as Malinga loses his radar, Taylor is good enough to wait for it and clip it neatly backward of square. Zimbabwe have hit their first four.
confident shot, 143 kph away swinger outside off, Taylor gets close to the line and drives on the up, but finds cover this time.
begins with one that tails into the pads and it is worked off the pads for a couple
he's getting the inducker going here. Chakabva covers the line and defends this time
back of a length outside off, Chakabva steers with an opened face, backward of point for one

lovely delivery, huge lbw appeal, turned down and not reviewed. Another huge inducker from Kula, curves in off his arm and comes into Taylor who has the tendency to play around the pads a bit. He was doing just that today, and seemed to be struck in front of middle. Would that have hit leg? Replays awaited. Ah, they are in, and it was missing leg. Good decision not to review it.
again Kula gets it to come into Taylor, who this time waits and turns the wrists at the same time. A couple to midwicket
an overthrow to end the over., Taylor pushes outside the line to another in-coming ball and plays it to the leg side. Needless throw gives an extra run
back of a length outside off, Chakabva dabs it through point for one
fastish away-swinger, Malinga and Kula complement each other so well. Chakava leaves this time
pacy away-swinger, this time at 142 kph, Chakabva leaves. Extra bounce too for Malinga, but it dies on the way to Sanga
closer to the stumps this time, Chakabva jumps into line and defends into the covers
sprayed. Malinga again sends one well down the leg side for five wides. Sanga had no chance of collecting that one
back to normal service, back of a length and darting away as Chakabva leaves
here comes the yorker, on middle stump but not at his normal pace. Chakabva manages to bunt it wide of mid on for one

whoa, Kulasekara is getting the ball to do magic here. Another one comes out of his hand wide of the crease, decides to swerve in like a deranged drunk around halfway down the pitch, and Chakabva's attempt to cut ends in very ungainly fashion. Misses the inside edge, and nearly hits the off stump
back of a length this time, Chakabva is conscious to cover the line and defends to the leg side
timing from Chakabva. Shades of Taibu as he stands solidly next to the line and punches crisply through point for three runs.
Taylor again plonks the pad in a very dangerous spot as Kula swerves it into middle stump. He manages to get a leg bye to short fine leg
back of a length on off stump, Chakabva reaches out and defends
ends the over with one that holds it line outside off, Chakabva lets it go
Malinga all over the shop. Another wide that landed nearly outside the pitch outside off.

aha, escape for both batsmen. Length ball on off stump, Taylor is into the drive early and nearly chips it back. If Malinga had held it, Taylor would have been gone. If he'd touched it, Chakabva would have been gone. He was well out of the crease when the ball crashed into off stump at the bowler's end.
nicely done, Chakabva stays on the crease and taps a back of length ball to the leg side for one
Taylor threads the gap in the covers - lives up to his name really. And what timing. Length ball on off stump, Taylor just pushes it after getting half forward. Lovely stroke.

Ohho! Malinga responds with a spirited ball on off stump that jumps up off a length and hits the splice as Taylor plays forward. The bat is broken! The handle-blade joint is cracked. He wants a new one, understandably.

get the Pepsi folks to get in touch with Taylor. A shot needs patenting here. 'The perpendicular cut' is how we define it. It is an upper dab of sorts, but there is no room outside off. In fact, it is a short ball on off stump, Taylor just stays stable, waits for it to reach him and then opens the face of the bat to steer it straight over the keeper's head. Lovely to watch. He played it against NZ too, inexplicably, over fine leg.
he's using Malinga's pace here, waiting for the ball to burst through and then dabbing backward of square
backfoot for Malinga, front foot for Kula. Taylor leans out and taps into the covers for another single
short of a length and well wide outside off. Chakabva misses the cut.
slow legcutter, Chakabva is on the front foot as he defends
terrific from Kula. He's bowled inswingers all day, and now sends out another legcutter that nips away, making Chakabva look ordinary as he pokes at it. It was too good for his edge.
back of a length again, Chakabva watches closely and covers the line to defend

holy moly, how did that miss the stumps? Kula sends in another humongous inswinger, Chakabva is not even close to being in the same zip code as someone who might pick it. He pokes away, expecting an away swinger this time, and gets the inner edge that goes straight down and bounces over the middle and leg stump.
Taylor chugs along, short ball outside off and he's cut it away backward of point for a couple
closer to good length, Taylor lunges out to defend with an opened face into the off side
again, back of driving length, Taylor waits and punches on the up into the covers for a single
good lengths these, and a hint of away movement now for Perera. Chakabva opens the face and defends from the crease towards point
through him with pace and bounce. 136 kph, and that touch of away seam again. Chakabva plays down the wrong line, not for the first time tonight.
single to end the over, Chakabva drops to the leg side and speeds away
back of a length outside off, played into the off saide with an opened face. Chakabva needs to rotate the strike better.
fuller length, Chakabva reaches out defensively and plays to the off side again
he now walks down the track, but Kula is not giving him anything to drive. Pushed to the off side with the full face of the bat. And then he quickly gets back into his crease.
Kula delivers another one of 'em yo-yo indippers, Chakabva manages to get bat on it and defend to the leg side, which is an accomplishment in itself.
again looks to force through the off side, and again plays down the wrong line. Ends up getting a thin outside edge to third man for a single
length ball to end the over, Taylor guides it straight to cover off the front foot
short of a length outside Chakabva's off stump, and this time he turns the strike over
fuller length, Taylor looks for the forced cover drive but plays it straight into the turf. A late decision for a single, almost ended up in a run out. The throw from mid off missed though.
play and a miss. Short ball outside off, it was there to be spanked and Chakabva missed.
width again, Chakabva looks to punch square but again finds point
tight stuff this from Perera, Chakabva is reduced into playing the forward defensive again. This is taking Zim no where.

So far, a forgettable evening for Malinga. He's let the pressure off with a rather shoddy performance at third man. Short ball outside Chakabva's off stump, he goes for the cut and gets it away to third man. Malinga moves across lazily, never looked like covering it, and let it slip through.
Zim reach 50 in style. Taylor takes two steps down, gets close to the pitch and then just bulldozes the length ball on the up and straight back over Kula's head. Couple of bounces and four
slowish delivery, 128 kph cutter that comes off slowly, and Taylor defends to the off side
short of a length again, Taylor presses forward to cover the line and plays with an opened face through backward point

well, well, Zimbabwe don't think this is over. Tay;lor sure doesn't. This is top improvisation, he again takes just two steps out and more importantly, across. Kula's inward angle means it ends up in the hitting area and he just thumps it cleanly across the line through midwicket.
and now the stolen single, Taylor walks into another length ball, plays it between the bowler and mid-off and scurries through
Chakabva ends the over with a dour defensive shot down the track.
short of a length on off, Taylor mistimes the push to the leg side and takes advantage of that to take another single.
well done Chakabva, quietly takes a single to turn the strike over. Full delivery angling in, he drops it to the leg side and gets one.
full away-swinger outside off, Taylor sets himself up and swats the cover drive emphatically. Plays this one straight to cover though.
back of a length and angling into Taylor who gets too far across and is hit on the box as he looks to work it to the leg side.

that's not the reaction you expect from someone who's been hit in the box! Taylor is seeing them early and hitting them with a vengeance today. He again shimmies across to middle and off, gets well enough inside the line to unfurl an imperious swat-pull over deep midwicket. Call your friends, this chase is on.

oh boy, another delightful stroke. Taylor is all over Sri Lanka at the moment. If your name is Taylor, come across to Pallekele. Brendan skips to off stump, gets a back of a length ball and cracks it straight down the ground for four more
indipper from Kula, Chakabva manages to get the front foot out of the way and defend to the off side
a single now, over to Taylor. Hangs back on off stump and steers backward of point for another single

This may be the end of Taylor, as Sri Lanka review an lbw appeal that was turned down. Height can be Taylor's only saviour. As always Kula gets the indipper to come in, Taylor tries to get across and shovel it to the leg side. It's hit him well over the pad, though Taylor was crouching as he played it, and replays say it was only clipping the bails. The review corroborates Umpire Erasmus' call.
yorker to follow up that delivery. Taylor just defends calmly back down the track
length ball on off, Taylor looks to ease into the drive but finds cover
he keeps strike at the end of an interesting over, Perera gets it to angle into the pads and he flicks square for a single

that's the Taylor version of the Helicopter shot. It is a rolling flick of the wrists, where the bat speed is so good that the bat swing finishes over his head and heading further backwards. The ball, menawhile, has flown away through wide mid on.
the big offcutter now, Taylor is on middle and off as he gropes to defend. Good comeback
another one nips into Taylor, he gets an inside edge onto the pads as he defends

bad, bad night for Malinga. He's got a piece of his mind from Perera after dropping a swirler at third man. Short of a length on off, Taylor is too early on the shovel-hoick to the leg side, and gets a leading edge. Malinga runs too far in and then has to backtrack as he realises the ball is going to land in between him and the ropes. He can't get into a good position and the ball slips through and lands inside the rope. Wake up, Sri Lanka!
Chakabva defends another indipper into the off side
in line with off stump to end the over, defended into the off side
Taylor gets a length ball on off stump and defends sedately

Taylor has 50 in no time. A smattering of cheers from a mostly subdued crowd. This game is not over. Length ball on middle and off, quietly pushed to mid on or a single. He needs to carry on. This line-up begins with Taylor and ends with Taibu.
Chakabva steers a single to third man, stays beside the line and opens the face to dab to third man

shades of Kallis as Taylor unfurls a wholesome cover drive. Slower ball, comes off well and lands on a fuller length, but Taylor picks it, waits and then essays the smoothest of drives into the covers. The placement was perfect too, and the high elbow finish was a treat to watch.
on the pads and Taylor keeps rolling, with a well timed flick once again to Malinga, who once again is slow onto the ball. Two more runs to the cause.

another huge inswinger, and not for the first time today, Taylor is troubled by that particular ball as he plays across the line. Hmm, not reviewed this time. Height and movement could have been going in his favour.
slow offcutter to start off, lands on off and nips in, Taylor defends
another slower one, comes off so gingerly off the hand and kisses the surface, so it doesn't bounce much at all. Taylor was early on the poke and missed it altogether.
this one comes in with the angle and Taylor works it to the leg side for one
wasted bouncer, slides down the leg side and was too high. Called a wide, could have been called on two counts.
length ball on middle and leg, defended cautiously off the front foot

aha, the rub of the green has seen Malinga, has applied the brakes, taken an u-turn and is heading the other way for now. Slow offcutter, Chakabva was really early on the chip shot and ended up scooping it, somehow safely, just over midwicket
fuller length ball outside off, Taylor opens the face and defends backward of point
pacy delivery outside off, defended off the back foot as it breaks in
fuller length and closer to off, Chakabva covers the line and defends down the track

huge appeal for lbw, turned down and not reviewed. Murali possibly landed this outside leg and almost surely it was turning down the leg side. A leg bye is taken. Aha, if this was refered it would have been out! It landed on leg and was hitting leg.
Taylor hands back and dabs a single to backward square leg
Surprise, surprise. Chakabva has a boundary. Poor ball from Murali, tossed up well outside off, allowing Chakabva to lay into the cut and place it fine enough to beat the sweeper
better line, closer to off stump but Chakabva pushes into the covers for another single
length ball on off stump, nothing much off the track, defended to the off side
back of a length outside off, Chakabva places the ball perfectly - he plays it straight to Malinga and they scurry a couple before the throw comes in from third man
back of a length slower ball on off stump, Chakabva defends with the deviation to the leg side

Chakabva is rolling away now. Zimbabwe are 101 for 0. Pinch yourself. Ouch! Short and wide outside off, Chakabva sets up a stable position on leg stump and cracks a super cut for four. Waited, waited and ensured he did not over hit it.
and now a single, length ball, dropped into the off side and over to Taylor.
Taylor keeps strike, rides the bounce on off stump and dabs to third man for a single
gets forward to turn a loopy delivery towards midwicket
goes straight on across the batsman, who comes out and defends
sweeps a fuller delivery to fine leg
gets back to cut this one away wide of deep point
goes straight on leg stump, he works it backward of square leg
looks to sweep from a foot outside off stump, and is hit on the back leg by the spinning off break
brings out the front foot and pushed this one away towards extra cover
now he brings the front foot across outside off stump, and pushes in front of pad to turn this backward of square leg
steers a ball very close to the body, gets it away to third man
works a length ball with the angle to deep midwicket
cuts back in on leg stump, turned away towards deep midwicket
gets a full one on the pads, and chips in the air to deep midwicket, it's the time for singles, and they are being milked
shot! he has picked a flat one from wide outside off stump, got down on a knee and swept in front of square leg, beats the man on the boundary by a long way
now he opens up and eases a full one on the stumps to long off
turning in sharply around off, he pushes forward in defence
Regis tries to do a Taylor, goes sweeping from outside off stump, but it goes off the inside edge fine on the leg side

Murali works his magic, the doosra gets Chakabva, almost the perfect delivery, tossed up and pitched around off stump on a length, drew the batsman forward, and just moved past his forward push to hit off stump, that will do, Sri Lanka have the breakthrough, after ages
flighted outside off stump, makes him come forward as he looks to smother the  turn, there isn't any, another one goes straight on, lovely delivery
played out to midwicket off the back foot

digs in the bouncer, Taylor thought about the vertical cut  over the keeper's head, but could not connect, Sri Lanka were interested for some time about the possibility of an edge, there did not seem to be any
worked away off the hips wide of fine leg
goes meeting this one outside off with a confident push, and gets it past point
short of a length outside off, steered to third man
another one back of a length around off stump, no room to work it away, blocked with a dead bat
Taibu was going to play the reverse sweep, no matter what, and gets it off the middle of the bat to third man
the conventional one from Taylor this time, down to fine leg
Mahela the seer, predicted that Taibu would reverse sweep, and started to go wide at slip, and he was right, Taibu played the shot, and Mahela was there to stop it
the doosra again, they are not picking it, not even Taylor, beaten on the forward push outside off
the sweep works just fine for Taylor, gets it down to fine leg
another reverse sweep, the third time on the trot, and he connects pretty decently too

Kumar Sangakkara, what a catch, superlative, he was initially moving to the leg side as this one was angled in to the batsman, it straightened around middle stump, Taibu had no chance with it, he edged it, and the ball was dying to the right of Sanga, who stopped his movement in the opposite direction, and went diving to take it inches from the ground
blocked off the front foot, it was a length ball around off
goes across the stumps, and works this one away towards midwicket
another confident forward defensive push, it is blocked so firmly it goes past extra cover, and Utseya even thought about a second for a moment
stays in the crease and flicks it away to deep midwicket
defended solidly off the back foot, he is meeting them with the meat of the blade
floated up way outside off and turns in, he plays it back to the bowler from the crease
bowls it much fuller and around middle, he goes for the paddle sweep, but Chamara at short fine leg goes diving to his right to save a certain four
pushed in front of cover for a single
he is happy to sweep everything that is marginally fuller, Thisara running in at fine leg concedes an extra run with some sloppy work
eased away down the ground to long on
slowly flighted, dips and turns in around middle, he gets an inside edge to short fine as he defends, and they are wise enough to not attempt the single

and strikes right away, it is the big fish, it was the slower one, the angle and the fuller length lured Taylor into going for the lofted shot over midwicket, but he ended up hitting it straight to the man in the end, Taylor is disgusted with his shot as he walks back
angles it across the left-hander, and he decides to leave it from a length, that was not far from off stump
driven forcefully to short extra cover off the front foot

the periscope shot, it was the bouncer, but didn't get that high, Ervine went down on it, but forgot to take the bat down with him, and the ball hit the back part of the bat and went flying fine on the leg side
Chamara pulls off a good save on the off side, it was driven off the front foot
steered away to third man from the crease
flighted from round the stumps, defended down the track
ends up on leg stump, and he sweeps to fine leg
goes across the batsman outside off stump, thick edge goes to third man
loud appeal from Sanga, polite question from Murali, neither moves umpire Erasmus, seemed to be struck outside off as he pushed outside the line of the ball
driven down the ground to long off
pushed through quicker and across the right hander, he is beaten as he pokes at it from the crease
the front foot was a long way across the stumps, but he brought down the bat in time to work the length ball through midwicket
punched away to mid off, off the back foot to a short of a length ball
gets some width outside off stump and steers it to squarish third man
drives a fuller one down the ground, closed the face of the blade and it went past the diving bowler, mid off gives chase
that will help Zimbabwe, went hard at one angled wide outside off stump, and the thick edge flew wide of third man who went through the motions of trying to get to it
punched away off the back foot to sweeper cover
from round the stumps, and gets it on middle, blocked down the track
eased away to the left of the bowler, midwicket comes running in, but does not pick it cleanly and they get the single in the end

Sanga appeared to have messed the stumping, Dilshan managed to draw Utseya out of the crease, and then got it to go straight on past the bat, Sanga fluffed the take, somehow the ball managed to deflect on to the stumps, and the off bail was dislodged before Utseya got back, as the replays confirm after a confident Sanga appealed
pushes forward confidently in to the off side
and Dilshan gets the outside edge as Elton goes pushing away from the body, but the ball goes wide of slip
punched off the back foot down the track
goes for the yorker right away, it ends up as a high full toss outside off stump, and moves away late in the air to beat the batsman's flail
129.3 kph, gets the yorker almost in place, pitches very full, but not in the blockhole that allows him to dig it out
he is targetting the stumps every ball, this time he comes out and turns it away to mid on
gets it further up now, and outside off stump, that late movement again, as he misses out on the drive
brings down an angled bat at it at a full one that again tails away late, and squeezes it out to third man
fired full and wide down the leg side
not getting it right again, but just about there, just short of the blockhole, this will test Zimbabwe, he turns it wide of mid on
blocked off the front foot down the track
goes back and punches it to long on

Dilshan can do no wrong today, fires one in from round the stumps, and gets it to strike him on the pads as he misses the sweep, that straightened neatly, umpire Erasmus gave the decision in Dilshan's favour after a fervent appeal, Zimbabwe went for the review, that was hitting middle, and Ervine has to walk back

Mahela, what a ripper, Dilshan is all over Zimbabwe, this one doesn't turn as he goes forward pushing inside the line, the edge flies between keeper and slip, from where Mahela puts out his left hand in a reflex motion, and pouches the blinder, two in two for Dilshan

Dilshan has the hat trick, no he does not, Mahela drops a low catch at slip, or did it fall just short, he managed to get his hands to the ball, Dilshan had produced another outside edge, a hattrick and a century, so close was Dilshan
defended down the track off the front foot
slower one, he has a swing at it outside off stump, and is beaten comfortably

Sri Lanka are blowing hot and cold, Malinga surprised him with the boucer, he went for the hook, and the outside edge stayed for ages in the sky before it came down to Murali at fine leg and he clanged it
goes for the yorker now, Malinga is steaming in now, just manages to push it to mid on
does the right thing, gets out of the way of a short one banged in that does not get that far up outside off stump

what does Malinga do to get a wicket  today? went for the yorker, but it ended up as a full toss on the stumps, seemed like it had gone through him, but he got the faintest of inside edges on it and it screamed fine on the leg side
gets the yorker on target, well bowled, but he manages to get bat on it just on time, and it scoots away down the ground on the leg side
full and driven back to the bowler, who lets it go through his hands
fired in quicker outside off stump, turns in and beats him even as he goes for the drive
still fuller, on the stumps, this time it's driven to long on
sharp turn from outside off stump, he goes back and cuts it away to cover

Sri Lanka have held on, another one goes, it was Perera on the deep square leg boundary, Elton went down to a full delivery and belted it off the middle of the bat, but his sweep went in the air straight to Perera, who tumbled forward but held on to the bat
tossed up outside off and turning in, defends to the off side
yorker almost on the spot, lands around the toes and is clipped to midwicket for one
they are searing in at some pace now, defended somehow to the off side. It is reversing.
another thunderbolt, defended from the crease to the leg side.
and again. Price is hanging back, showing his stumps and just defending from the crease as Malinga bends them back in.
Sanga is on fire today. He's saved four leg byes, flying away to his left and stopping a scorcher that was moving at speed, and was headed for the fine leg fence.
and again, another yorker goes wrong and is headed for the boundary down the leg side. Try telling Sangakkara.
hmm, ain't Malinga's day at all. This time he misses the yorker by a foot or so, Price waits and thumps the low full toss through the covers
back of a length to end the over, Price stays behind the line
length ball on off, defended to the off side
enough width outside off for Cremer to rock back and cut backward of point. There's dew coming down now, a bit of a mess in the deep and they get a couple
closer to the stumps this time and turning in, Cremer defends from the crease
Cremer again reaches out to the flight and defends down the track
on the pads, tucked with the spin to midwicket as the crowd settles into a swaying Mexican wave.
flighted on off stump, again the forward defensive
back of a length on off stump, defended back down the track
looks for the yorker this time, and it is dug out to mid on for a rather risky single. The throw from the fielder shamara Silva doesn't miss by much
the lethal bouncer, Price ducks away for dear life and then hits the bat hard on the pad since he's not happy to have let it go!
another short one whistles by outside off, Price tries to slap along to third man and misses
now he plays the fly-swat at another short ball that jumps up from back of a length. Price tries to stay under it, and as it goes he has a feel for it. No luck.

Price is getting the odd boundary away as Malinga's night to forget continues. Slower ball delivered full and just outside off, Price stays back and slaps it with a flick of the wrists straight back over the bowler's head
length ball outside off, played cautiously to the off side
back of a length and coming in off the seam, defended to the leg side unconvincingly
this one slides past the outside edge as Cremer tries a leaden footed poke
slips this one down the leg side for a wide as Cremer misses the swipe
again that patent Kulasekara inducker, Cremer does well to not fall over as he plays around the front pad to the leg side.
legcutter from the back of the hand, forced into the off side off the back foot as it bounces extra
again tries to force through cover point off the back foot as Kula keeps it outside off. Just one run from that over, due to the wide.
whistles in back of a length outside off, and Price flails at it and misses
short of a length and coming in, Price forces it off the back foot down the track
short delivery, comes off at 134 kph and Price is unable to time the pull. Finds midwicket
another short ball, this time Price is early in position and hauls it away through midwicket. Not timed too well, but an easy couple

Perera has removed Price with yet another short ball. Ironically, it is the first one he really caught hold of, he saw it early, waited for it and swatted it powerfully, but straight to the man at deep square leg
short of a length, tight line on off stump, Cremer defends with undue caution
tossed up on off and turning in, defended down the track
loopy on off, defends off the front foot down the track
outside off, blocked again solidly to the off side

4 for 4 and a century. Dilshan is unstoppable today. Lovely delivery, the slider than lands on a length around off and shoots through. Panyangara was groping inside the line, expecting an offie. No luck, the ball darts past the outside edge and hits him plumb in front. No need to review those.
flighted outside off, nervously defended down the track
tossed up again, and hunting for the edge, played into the covers carefully.
Not many people will play the reverse sweep in this setting to a ball churned out on leg stump. Cremer misses and gets a bye as the ball slips down the leg side
Mpofu gets a single, swiping through midwicket and he's away
flighted outside off, defended to the off side against the spin
turning down the leg side, worked with the spin through square leg for another single

I can't believe Nigel Llong hasn't given it out lbw. Sanga reviews an lbw appeal. The bounce has saved him. Or so says Hawkeye. Lands on a length around middle and off and then turns away. The perfect doosra, Mpofu had no cluse what it was doing. According to Hawk-Eye it is missing by half a foot.

aha, so what if the replays don't vindicate you. Murali decides to do it all by himself, lands the doosra outside leg stump and turns it around to hit the timber as Mopfu sweeps and misses. The wizard has finished his final game at home with a wicket. Sri Lanka are the first team to enter the quarters of World Cup 2011.
